body.name: GIGABYTE B650I AORUS Ultra Mini-ITX AM5 Motherboard with DDR5, PCIe 5.0, Wi-Fi 6E, 5-Year Warranty

deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 17 hrs 44 mins.
features: AMD AM5 Socket: Supports AMD Ryzen 7000 Series Processors
DDR5 Compatible: 2 SMD DIMMs with AMD EXPO and Intel XMP Memory Module Support
Commanding Power Design: Direct 8 plus2 plus1 Phases Digital VRM Solution, 12-layer 2X Copper PCB
Cutting-Edge Thermal Design: Extended VRM Heatsink with Heatpipe, Fully Covered MOSFET Heatsinks, M.2 Thermal Guard III with Active Cooling, Ultra Durable Memory Armor
Next Gen Connectivity: PCIe 5.0, PCIe 4.0 NVMe x4 M.2, USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C with DP-Alt
EZ-Latch: M.2 Connectors with a Quick Release and Screwless Design

Fine Tuning Features: RGB FUSION, Supports Addressable LED and RGB LED Strips, Smart Fan 6, Multi-key for Reset/RGB Switch/Direct to BIOS/Safe Mode, Q-Flash Plus - Update BIOS without installing CPU, Memory, and GPU
body.description: 5-Year Warranty AMD AM5 Socket: Supports AMD Ryzen 7000 Series Processors DDR5 Compatible: 2*SMD DIMMs with AMD EXPO & Intel XMP Memory Module Support Commanding Power Design: Direct 8+2+1 Phases Digital VRM Solution, 12-layer 2X Copper PCB Cutting-Edge Thermal Design: Extended VRM Heatsink with Heatpipe, Fully Covered MOSFET Heatsinks, M.2 Thermal Guard III with Active Cooling, Ultra Durable Memory Armor Next Gen Connectivity: PCIe 5.0, PCIe 4.0 NVMe x4 M.2, USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C with DP-Alt EZ-Latch: M.2 Connectors with a Quick Release & Screwless Design Fast Networking: Intel 2.5GbE LAN Dynamic Audio: ALC4080 HD Audio Fine Tuning Features: RGB FUSION, Supports Addressable LED & RGB LED Strips, Smart Fan 6, Multi-key for Reset/RGB Switch/Direct to BIOS/Safe Mode, Q-Flash Plus - Update BIOS without installing CPU, Memory, and GPU. A new era is here. The B650I AORUS ULTRA supports AM5 Processors and features unparalleled performance. GIGABYTE B650 motherboards come with upgraded power design, high grade storage standards, and outstanding connectivity that enables you to optimize your performance

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.8 3.8 out of 5 stars 75 ratings 3.8 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have the version 1.1Feels expensive, the back plate functions as a cooler for a m.2. The layout for the fan and rgb connectors is weird, but nothing too concerning.There is a daughetboard that is tricky to connect the first time but again, you do it just once and you are good to go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very good board.
reviews.reviewText: For the price, this is the BEST Mini-ITX AM5 motherboard. The build quality is exceptional. This thing is HEAVY because it comes with a 12-layer PCB with serious cooling as well as a metal back-plate and integrated IO shield. This board has surprising cooler compatibility, even if it comes close to not fitting some larger coolers. Everything is robust and reinforced, and the ports are solid and satisfying. I had minor issues with the included WiFi which seems to have sorted itself out. However, the WiFi signal quality and speed are among the best I've ever seen! The included antenna is not one to throw away. It's actually nice because it can fold to different positions, and attach with solid magnets. Another thing I really appreciate is that it can hold 3x NVME drives, which I find very impressive. One star off for the lack of an included user manual and the terrible instructions for a BIOS upgrade. A user manual is important because this board makes some really strange design choices to fit all of the expected connectivity on this board. For example, I had to remove the M.2 cooling shroud to get to the HD audio connector. I recommend using the Q-Flash Plus button on the back of the motherboard for BIOS upgrades because it makes it very easy. Just note there are very specific instructions that you have to follow, easily found online. I feel that $260 was a fair price considering how premium this motherboard is. It easily matches or surpasses the quality of some $500 motherboards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Didn't POST + design flaws
reviews.reviewText: This is one of the most frustrating boards I've ever tried to use:1. The front panel plug on the daughter board straight up doesn't fit the provided adapter, and eventually broke because of the sideways orientation2. Hasn't posted (CPU/GPU fans still run) even with updating the BIOS, keeping it on for 30+ minutes, and having the bare minimum plugged into the board. All parts are compatible according to their website and other completed builds.3. No status LED to diagnose errorsThere are also a bunch of weird design choices that don't make logical sense when you're building. It's unfortunate that there are so few options compared to previous generations, as each board seems to have multiple cons.Update: Bought the MSI B650i Edge and everything works now. Slightly fewer features (and a few flaws of its own), but the status LEDs helped with troubleshooting and the layout is much more intuitive.Keeping the 1* review here because of all the tradeoffs and design flaws.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Mini ITX board
reviews.reviewText: Have this bad boy in my thermaltake 200 series case and absolutely love it!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's not Asus.. So that's a major plus!
reviews.reviewText: I switched to this after Asus made it seem like they wouldn't cover my 7950X3d if their bios killed it.This MB comes with 1 extra nvme slot. And the expansion board doesn't interfere with the heatsink.I put this in a Torrent Nano Case with a 4080 FE and Noctua NH-D15S.So far so good after 4 Months!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Extremely nifty motherboard with terrible cable management
reviews.reviewText: What can I say, after the messy Z690i Aorus Ultra Gigabyte lost me, but this was a straight banger. What else can I ask for? It as 3 NVMe slots, supports extremely high end kits and gets the job done of handling my 7950x3D with ease.I do with they didn’t have a dongle for everything though. eg to connect fans, gigabyte has a dongle for that. If you want to use the ARGB headers they have another dongle for that, and the same for the front panel audio and USB 2 ports. It becomes a cluttered mess ruining cable management.Eventually I was able to get my build to look clean by making sacrifices on some of those ports.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Maybe just a defective board
reviews.reviewText: Seemed to work fine, until I plugged all my USB devices in. Even though it’s has many USB ports, it couldn’t provide power to 4 devices (Mouse, Keyboard, Wireless headphones, and microphone). Windows would say not enough resources for the USB devices then lock up. So I got a AC powered USB hub and plugged everything in there. This time no warnings just freeze.I never had any problems with Gigabyte, in fact it was my go to brand, but their design choices for this board was a pain. That flimsy riser card for SATA and other common mobo features is terrible. Returned instead of exchanged because of that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good quality board with everything i needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Funciona bien, pero tiene demasiadas tarjetas secundarias.
reviews.reviewText: El motherboard funciona bien, y la verdad lo escogí por que era el que tenía mas features entre las tarjetas itx para am5, sin embargo para lograr esto muchos de los puertos como SATA y M.2 están montados en tarjetas secundarias, incluso algunos headers para abanicos y switches también. Fue todo un reto conectar todo ya que incluso cosas básicas como el switch de encendido va montado en un adaptador, que a su vez se conecta a una tarjeta secundaria.Especificamente para mi gabinete, el NZXT H1v2, fue necesario quitarle el disipador de calor al puerto M.2 PCIe 5 para que pudieran caber los tubos del enfriador AiO que viene incluido.En general funciona bien y fue facil habilitar los EXPO timings para mi memoria, tambien no he tenido problemas para que mi CPU mantenga sus relojes tope.En general lo recomiendo pero quizá para gabinetes no tan compactos será una mejor opción.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: With so many features, If you're building an AMD rig, this board is a solid pick for sure!Great for overclocking and underclocking to keep the temps in check

reviews.reviewTitle: Placa excelente, solo su plug de expansión es muy sencillo.
reviews.reviewText: La placa cumple con todas las especificaciones a pesar de sus dimensiones tan pequeñas, genial para actualizar tu pc por varios años más. Solo el GC-B650I BTB PLUG que le da a la placa madre más funciones es de plastico muy delgado y si no se hacen las conexiones con cuidado puede romperse (como a mí me pasó con el conector de los FAN o ventilador de esta plug, el cual al desconectar para acomodar los cables se rompio la protección plástica que le rodea. No me preocupé tanto porque los postes metálicos para las conecciones del FAN quedaron intactos y funcionales). Salvo por eso, la mother es fantástica.
